A Rational Approach to an Irrational Market

Members Area

Secure Your Future

Turn one paycheck into a new car with the Free Market Insights strategy. With 6 easy steps, you can be on your way to financial freedom and a better future. We have all the information and techniques you need to ensure a better life yourself and everyone you love

Our Mission

The birth of low cost finance softwares has fostered a new way to manage your money. Over are the times of self-interested brokers, high trading fees, limited access to real-time stock information, and high barriers of entry into investing. Our mission is to offer education, research, and techniques for everyone to use to earn the same returns offered by a financial advisor for a fraction of the cost. With the internet, investing is easy, yet people every year further themselves from retirement either by paying heft fees for a financial advisor, or not investing at all. Our goal is to take the fear out of personal investing and to empower everyone to own his or her financial future.

Our Strategy



At FMI, we recommend using low cost technologies combined with academically researched stock filtering strategies to enable you to earn the same returns offered by financial advisors for a fraction of the cost. We believe there are 4 easy steps to securing your financial future today.



5 Easy Steps to Financial Freedom

Click through the steps to learn more


Open an Investment Account

Open a low cost investment account. There are tons of options out there such as Robinhood, Acorns, Wealthfront, Yahoo Finance, Yieldstreet, and others. However, we recommend Robinhood. To learn more about our recommendation, you can read this article

Determine Your Contribution

Your goal should be to stash away as much money into your investment account as possible after paying your bills. $5,000 today will be worth $87,000 in 30 years, but $5,000 in 10 years will only be worth $33,000 in 10 years. The goal is to get as much into the account as soon as possible and leave it in the account. To achieve this, pick a contribution amount and frequency that you can afford.

Choose Your Investment Vehicle

Your investment experience will determine how you should invest your money. New investors should invest in index funds such as the SnP500, NASDAQ, Russell200, and others. The index funds will earn the market return and provide substantial dividend income on a consistent baiss. Experienced investors will use these indecies as benchmarks and attempt to outperform. There are a variety of methods to outperform the market which can be learned about in our Research Papers, but in general, the goal is to create a diversified portfolio that holds stocks with better fundamentals and more upside potential than their peers, thus outperforming the market over time.

Don't Quit and Don't Exit!

The biggest mistake an investor can make is exiting the market. After a gain, taxes are detrimental and must be paid everytime you exit an investment. After or during a loss, investors often get scared, but history has shown that index funds have massive gains after lossess 100% of the time. In some risky single stock plays, there is a chance for stock bankrupcy, however, if you follow the FMI philosophy, the chance for bankruptcy is almost zero as well. The best option is to hold out for the rain to go away.

Match or Beat the Market

The market on average earns 8% annually. Including compounding effects, it has earned just over 6% every single year for the past 100 years. There are a variety of drivers for the market growth such as technological advancement, population growth, consumer behavior, and emerging markets. And all of these drivers continue to trend upwards. Let the market win for you and help you secure the financial security you will want in the future. Invest in index funds. If you feel up to the challenge, read our research and learn how to create your own diversified portfolio that beats your index of choice. Try not to look at your investment account as emotions will put you at risk of exit. Lean back, enjoy the growth, and welcome to philosophy of Free Market Insights.

If you want to learn more about our strategy, you can read our strategy article by using the button below.

Frequently Asked Questions

If you have any questions not addressed here, please contact us by heading to our research contact form Here

What is offered in the FMI membership?
The FMI membership unlocks all stock analytics engines on our website. You will also get exclusive content sent to your e-mail and will enable the personalized portfolio feature. With the personalized portfolio, you will be able to track your portfolio of stocks using the FMI analytics methodology, set target prices, and stay aware of changing fundamentals. There is no other place on the internet where this quality of analytics and portfolio tracking exists on the internet.

When should I start investing?
Short answer: today. Long answer: As soon as you possible
I want to Invest, but I just don't have the money
Do you wake up every morning with a freshly brewed cup on starbucks coffee? Do you have multiple entertainment subscriptions such as Netflix, Hulu and HBO? Do you spend money on online games or shopping on a weekly basis? Any of these activities can be forgone and that money can be invested starting today. A cup of coffe per day could be re-invested to be worth $1million over your lifetime
